decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of sufficiently precise and consistent information that the proposals would retain a sufficient amount of communal amenity space of a good quality for residents of the proposed development, contrary to Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies DM10 and DM11 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of adequate arboricultural information that the proposals would not have an adverse impact on protected trees within the site and in the vicinity on neighbouring properties, contrary to Policy G7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies DM10 and DM11 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).
description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 2 (Approved Plans) of Planning Permission ref: 19/01259/FUL (Alterations and extensions at ground, first and second floor levels associated with the the formation of 5no. new self-contained flats and modification of existing flats at Surbiton Court Mews following the demolition of  2no. garages and a single storey studio (formerly garage) (granted under Appeal ref: APP/Z5630/W/20/3250554) dated 27/11/2020. Variation to consist of changes to unit mix, amenity space and landscaping
